title: Ticket #7168: condor_chirp getdir segfaults with empty subdirectories
description:
When trying to use "condor_chirp getdir" with an empty directory, chirp fails with exit code 134, segfaults and dumps a core file.

Core file can be found below: http://stash.osgconnect.net/+khurtado/chirp_condor/

How to reproduce:

- In the submit directory on the submit/schedd node, create a directory structure like: 
$ mkdir -p test/empty
$ touch test/hello

- Then, condor_ssh_to_job to a sleep job with +WantIOProxy = True and use getdir. getdir will be successfull with test, but will segfault with test/empty 

condor_ssh_to_job 70066.0
Welcome to slot1@d6cneh004.crc.nd.edu!
Your condor job is running with pid(s) 21419.
bash-4.2$ condor_chirp getdir test
hello
empty

bash-4.2$ condor_chirp getdir test/empty
chirp: couldn't get response from server: No such file or directory
Aborted (core dumped)
bash-4.2$ echo $?
134
remarks:
2019-Jul-29 11:57:00 by jfrey:
I've found a few bugs in HTCondor's handling of getdir and getlongdir based on your report:

  • The condor_shadow treats an empty directory the same as failure to list the directory, but the errno is left unset (so can be any value).
  • The condor_starter treats a result code of 0 as a failure.
  • The chirp client code free()s an uninitialized buffer when the server returns an error (causing the crash you observed).

These should be easy to fix.

2019-Aug-06 12:48:36 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW change looks good.
